intro: Gravesia cistoides, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact shrub form with evergreen leaves. The plant produces fragrant, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for coastal gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract birds and insects.
